snippet: As the headlines from the Arab world get worse and worse, there is talk of the “power vacuum” in the region. Getting overlooked is the “values vacuum.”
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column contends that turmoil in the Arab world has less to do with a power vacuum brought on by American action, or inaction, and more to do with a values vacuum; highlights argument made in Marwan Muasher book The Second Arab Awakening and the Battle for Pluralism, which states that no sustainable progress will be made until the ethic of pluralism permeates all aspects of Arab society.
lead_paragraph: As the headlines from the Arab world get worse and worse, there is talk of the “power vacuum” in the region. Getting overlooked is the “values vacuum.”

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
